titles.title: A bill to amend titles 10 and 14, United States Code, to provide for the use of gold in the metal content of the Medal of Honor.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S516-517)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

bill.summary:
1/12/2007--Introduced.
Requires the metal content of the Medal of Honor, awarded by the President to members of the Armed Forces and Coast Guard, to be 90 percent gold and ten percent alloy.
